question: What should you do if you are involved in an accident?
answer: If you are involved in an accident, you should first ensure safety by stopping at the scene and calling the police and emergency services if there are any injuries or if any driver involved hasn’t stopped. question: What is covered under Section 1: Liability?
answer: Under Section 1: Liability, your car insurance policy provides cover for liability to other people (third parties) within the territorial limits in the countries listed in the 'Countries where you have minimum cover'. This includes injury to anyone working with or for the driver of the car, except as set out in the Road Traffic Act. If your policy includes Green Flag, it may also cover liability for accidents caused by your automated car when it is lawfully driving. Additional details and any restrictions can be found under each section of the policy.

question: What happens if your car is written off?
answer: If your car is written off, the insurance company may choose to either repair the damage themselves or pay you the value of the car if it's more cost-effective than repairing it. Once the claim is settled, your car will become the property of the insurance company, and you may need to send them the registration document. All cover will then end unless otherwise agreed.

question: What does the Vandalism Promise cover?
answer: The Vandalism Promise covers damage to your car that is a result of vandalism. If you claim for such damage, it won't affect the No Claim Discount on your policy. However, it's important to note that the Vandalism Promise doesn't cover damage caused by another vehicle.

It helps you claim your uninsured losses from the person who was to blame for the accident. This could include compensation for death or bodily injury.

Additionally, factors like driver-monitoring technology and any claims you make can also affect your premium.

question: What Does My Policy Cover If I Get into an Accident?
answer: Your policy covers personal accident up to the amounts shown in ‘What your cover includes’ on page 8. Additionally, you should provide your personal details, policy number, car registration number, and a description of the loss or damage if you are involved in an accident.
contexts: Your car insurance policy covers liability for injuries and property damage to others, as well as accidental damage to your car. It also includes personal benefits such as medical expenses, personal accident coverage, and the replacement of child car seats and in-car entertainment equipment. Additionally, you can receive a courtesy car during repairs and have protections like the Uninsured Driver Promise and Vandalism Promise, which safeguard your No Claim Discount under certain conditions. For complete details, refer to sections on liability, accidental damage, and personal benefits in your policy booklet.
ground_truth:
Section 1: Liability
Injuries to Other People: Covers injuries or death to others caused by an accident involving your car.
Property Damage: Covers damage to someone else's property.
Section 4: Accidental Damage
Accidental Damage to Your Car: Covers repairs or replacement of your car if it is damaged in an accident.
Child Car Seat Replacement: Covers the cost of replacing a child car seat if it is damaged in an accident.
In-car Entertainment: Covers in-car entertainment equipment that was permanently fitted in your car when it was made.
Section 6: Personal Benefits
Personal Accident: Provides financial help if you or your partner are accidentally injured or killed in a car accident involving your car.
Medical Expenses: Covers medical expenses for injuries resulting from an accident.
Hotel Expenses: Covers hotel expenses if you cannot drive your car after an accident.
Personal Belongings: Covers personal belongings if they are lost or damaged by an accident while they are in or on your car.
Uninsured Driver Promise
If you are involved in an accident that is not your fault and the other driver is uninsured, your No Claim Discount will not be affected, and you will not need to pay an excess once the fault is confirmed.

Vandalism Promise
If you claim for damage to your car caused by vandalism, it will not affect your No Claim Discount on the policy.

Courtesy Car
If your car is being repaired by an approved repairer, you will get a courtesy car to keep you mobile while your car is being repaired.

Additional Exclusions and Conditions
Legal Costs: Reasonable legal costs or expenses to defend or represent you in court.
Repairs and Replacements: Detailed information on how repairs and replacements are managed is found in sections 2, 4, and 5 of the policy.

question: What are the minimum liability coverage requirements?
answer:
The minimum liability coverage requirements for your car insurance policy include:

- Injuries to other people: Unlimited coverage
- Property damage: £20,000,000 per accident (includes all costs and expenses)
- Road traffic accident: £100,000 if this cover is included
- Motor contract dispute: £100,000 if this cover is included
- Motoring prosecution defense: £100,000 if this cover is included

These are the minimum liability coverage amounts provided by your policy.
contexts:
the minimum liability coverage requirements include:
Injuries to Other People: Unlimited coverage for injuries or death caused to other people.
Property Damage: Coverage up to £20,000,000 per accident, including all costs and expenses .
ground_truth:
the minimum liability coverage requirements include:
Injuries to Other People: Unlimited coverage for injuries or death caused to other people.
Property Damage: Coverage up to £20,000,000 per accident, including all costs and expenses .

question: What are the conditions under which my No Claim Discount (NCD) is protected?
answer: Your No Claim Discount (NCD) can be protected if you make up to 2 claims in 3 years of insurance in a row. This means that making up to 2 claims within this time frame won't affect the NCD on your policy. However, it's important to note that protected NCD doesn’t guarantee your premium – it may still increase if a claim is made. You may also have the option to protect your NCD by paying an additional premium.
contexts: Your NCD is protected if you make no more than 2 claims in 3 years. Protected NCD doesnât guarantee your premium wonât increase if a claim is made.
ground_truth: Protected NCD means that you can make up to 2 claims in 3 years without your No Claim Discount being affected.

question: What is the process if my car is written off and I have a lease or hire purchase agreement?
answer: If your car is written off and you have a lease or hire purchase agreement, the insurance company will typically pay any claims directly to the lease company or the legal owners of the car. This is because they are the legal owners of the vehicle. You may need to provide documentation or information about the lease or hire purchase agreement to facilitate this process.
contexts: If your car is written off, payments will be made to the lease or hire purchase company. Any remaining balance will be paid to you if you have the option to become the full owner at the end of the agreement.
ground_truth: If your car canât be repaired and youâre leasing it, weâll pay any claims to the lease company. If youâre buying it on hire purchase, weâll pay any claims to the legal owner.

question: How does the policy handle repairs if I choose my own repairer instead of an approved one?
answer: If you choose your own repairer instead of an approved one under the policy, the repairs will not be guaranteed by the insurance company, even if they pay for them directly. In this case, the repairs will not be treated as being carried out by the approved repairer. If there is a problem with any aspect of the repair, your first point of contact should be the repairer who did the original work.
contexts: Reasonable and necessary repairs can be carried out at a repairer of your choice, but these repairs will not be guaranteed by the insurer even if they pay for them directly.
ground_truth: Where the repairs are carried out at a repairer of your choice, those repairs will NOT be guaranteed by us even though we may pay for them directly.

question: What are the exclusions related to driving another car under my policy?
answer: Under your policy, the exclusions related to driving another car include not covering damage caused by any driver insured on the policy to any property they own or are responsible for. Additionally, liability for loss of, or accidental damage is not covered.
contexts: Your policy doesnât cover damage, fire, or theft of the car youâre driving, nor does it provide Motor Legal cover when driving another car.
ground_truth: We donât cover any damage, fire, or theft to the car youâre driving. We donât provide Motor Legal cover if youâre driving another car.

question: Under what conditions will the Uninsured Driver Promise apply?
answer: The Uninsured Driver Promise will apply if you are involved in a road traffic accident that isn't your fault, and the driver of the vehicle that hits your car is uninsured. In this case, the Uninsured Driver Promise will help you claim your uninsured losses from the person who was to blame for the accident.
contexts: The Uninsured Driver Promise applies if you are in an accident that isnât your fault, and the driver of the other vehicle is uninsured. You need to provide the registration number, make and model of the vehicle that hit you, the driverâs details, and any witness information.
ground_truth: If you claim for an accident that isnât your fault, and the driver of the vehicle that hits your car is uninsured, the No Claim Discount on this policy will not be affected and you will not need to pay an excess.

question: What does the policy cover under Motor Legal Cover?
answer: The policy under Motor Legal Cover covers costs if you need to take legal action or defend yourself in court.

ground_truth: Weâll provide cover for the costs to defend you in a criminal court within the territorial limits if youâre prosecuted for a motoring offence while using your car.

question: How does the Guaranteed Hire Car Plus work if my car is not driveable?
answer: If your car is not driveable and you have the Guaranteed Hire Car Plus cover, the insurance will extend this cover while you're unable to use your car. This means that if you can't drive your car due to lost or damaged car keys, the insurance will provide you with a hire car for the duration of the repair. If the insurance cannot provide you with a hire car for certain reasons outlined in the policy, they will repay your travel costs up to a certain limit per day. You can use this benefit within 21 days following your claim.

ground_truth: If your car can be repaired, and is not driveable, as soon as youâve confirmed that we can start the repair, weâll provide you with a hire car.

question: What actions should I avoid to prevent increasing the amount claimed?
answer: You must not do, or refrain from doing, anything that would increase the amount of the claim without the insurance company's written permission. For example, admitting liability for, or negotiating to settle, any claim could potentially increase the amount claimed.

question: What are the conditions for replacing car keys if they are stolen or lost abroad?
answer:
The conditions for replacing car keys if they are stolen abroad are:
- You must have Comprehensive cover and have added Foreign Use Extension to your policy before traveling.
- For Comprehensive Plus cover, 90 days of Foreign Use Extension is included.
- The policy covers up to £1,000 for the theft of car keys.
- You must take all reasonable steps to protect your car keys from theft.
- You will need to report the theft to the police and provide a crime reference number.
contexts: While driving abroad, car keys are covered if stolen when you have Comprehensive cover with a Foreign Use Extension or Comprehensive Plus cover. You must replace the keys and send receipts for reimbursement.
ground_truth: While driving your car abroad, weâll cover your car keys if they are stolen when you have Comprehensive cover and youâve added Foreign Use Extension.

question: What are the cancellation policy?
answer: If you decide to cancel your policy before it starts, you will receive a full refund. If you cancel during the 14-day cooling-off period, you will be charged for the time you had cover and refunded the rest of the premium paid. If you cancel after the cooling-off period, you will be charged for the time you had cover, an administration fee, and refunded any remaining premium paid. The policy can also be canceled by the insurance company if there are valid reasons, and they will provide at least 7 days' notice.
contexts:
Your Right to Cancel the Policy or Remove Any Optional Cover:
Before Cover Starts: Full refund.
During 14-Day Cooling-Off Period: Charge for the time you had cover, refund the rest.
After the 14-Day Cooling-Off Period: Charge for the time you had cover plus an administration fee, refund any remaining premium.
ground_truth:
Your Right to Cancel the Policy or Remove Any Optional Cover:
Before Cover Starts: Full refund.
During 14-Day Cooling-Off Period: Charge for the time you had cover, refund the rest.
After the 14-Day Cooling-Off Period: Charge for the time you had cover plus an administration fee, refund any remaining premium.

question: What to do incase I met an accident?
answer: If you are involved in an accident, you should first stop at the scene of the accident and ensure safety. If there are any injuries or if any driver involved hasn’t stopped, call the police and emergency services. Take photos of the accident if it’s safe to do so, including any vehicles involved. Exchange personal details, policy numbers, car registration numbers, and a description of the loss or damage with the other party.
contexts: If you have an accident, ensure everyone's safety and call emergency services if needed. Exchange details with the other driver(s) and gather information about the accident, including witness details. Report the accident to the police if there are injuries or the other driver leaves the scene. Notify your insurer as soon as possible by calling the claims number

Witnesses

5
Call us

question: Give me the  locations i will be covered?
answer: The territorial limits for coverage under the policy include Great Britain, Northern Ireland, the Channel Islands, and the Isle of Man.
contexts:
our car insurance covers the following areas:
Great Britain
Northern Ireland
The Channel Islands
The Isle of Man
ground_truth:
"The area your policy applies (the territorial limits)
Your car insurance gives you the cover described in your car insurance details in:
Great Britain.
Northern Ireland.
the Channel Islands.
the Isle of Man.
It also covers journeys between these places"
